Bumps [postcss](LINK from 8.3.11 to 8.4.4.
Release notes

Sourced from

8.4 “President Camio”

PostCSS 8.4 brought ranges for warnings and errors, smaller node_modules size, lazy parsing to avoid PostCSS does nothing warning, and TypeScript fixes.

Thanks to Sponsors

This release was possible thanks to our community.

If your company wants to support the sustainability of front-end infrastructure or wants to give some love to PostCSS, you can join our supporters by:

  • .

Rages for Errors and Warnings

for VS Code, added ranges to errors and warnings.

result.warn(msg, { index })           // One character warning at index
result.warn(msg, { endIndex })        // Starts at node start, ends at endIndex
result.warn(msg, { index, endIndex }) // Starts at index, ends at endIndex
result.warn(msg, { start })           // Starts at start, ends at node end
result.warn(msg, { end })             // Starts at node start, ends at end
result.warn(msg, { start, end })      // Starts at start, ends at end
result.warn(msg, { word })            // Starts at word location, ends at word index + length

It will improve DX in the IDE extension.

... (truncated)

Rages for Errors and Warnings

for VS Code, added ranges to errors and warnings.

result.warn(msg, { index })           // One character warning at index
result.warn(msg, { endIndex })        // Starts at node start, ends at endIndex
result.warn(msg, { index, endIndex }) // Starts at index, ends at endIndex
result.warn(msg, { start })           // Starts at start, ends at node end
result.warn(msg, { end })             // Starts at node start, ends at end
result.warn(msg, { start, end })      // Starts at start, ends at end
result.warn(msg, { word })            // Starts at word location, ends at word index + length

It will improve DX in the IDE extension.

Lazy Parsing

Previously, we found that many tools run PostCSS even if the developer didn’t pass any PostCSS plugins. Parsing is the most expensive step in CSS processing. It led to a waste of resources without any reason.

We tried to resolve the problem by adding a PostCSS does nothing warning. But it didn’t force tool authors to be more careful with user’s resources.

Release notes

Sourced from

8.4 “President Camio”

PostCSS 8.4 brought ranges for warnings and errors, smaller node_modules size, lazy parsing to avoid PostCSS does nothing warning, and TypeScript fixes.

Thanks to Sponsors

This release was possible thanks to our community.

If your company wants to support the sustainability of front-end infrastructure or wants to give some love to PostCSS, you can join our supporters by:

  • .

Rages for Errors and Warnings

for VS Code, added ranges to errors and warnings.

result.warn(msg, { index })           // One character warning at index
result.warn(msg, { endIndex })        // Starts at node start, ends at endIndex
result.warn(msg, { index, endIndex }) // Starts at index, ends at endIndex
result.warn(msg, { start })           // Starts at start, ends at node end
result.warn(msg, { end })             // Starts at node start, ends at end
result.warn(msg, { start, end })      // Starts at start, ends at end
result.warn(msg, { word })            // Starts at word location, ends at word index + length

It will improve DX in the IDE extension.

Lazy Parsing

Previously, we found that many tools run PostCSS even if the developer didn’t pass any PostCSS plugins. Parsing is the most expensive step in CSS processing. It led to a waste of resources without any reason.

We tried to resolve the problem by adding a PostCSS does nothing warning. But it didn’t force tool authors to be more careful with user’s resources.

If PostCSS sees that tool call it without passing plugins (or changing parser/stringifier), PostCSS will not parse CSS (until toll will call Result#root). In 8.4, PostCSS does nothing warning.

pr_title: Add badge for huntr.dev bounty program
pr_body:
I want to add this as we have a security file in the repository. We don't have any bug bounty program and I found huntr.dev can help us on keeping animate.css secure. I add a badge so everyone that discovers a potential security issue can directly report to huntr.dev. This is the current value of animate.css from their platform.

![image](LINK

You can also contact us via SECURITY.md file located at the root of this repo.

What do you think @eltonmesquita @daneden ?
I just update the license of animate.css as mentioned here: #1355

pr_title: Fix Badge License and Rename Files
pr_body:
I fix the badge license and also rename these files into lowercase.
It is acceptable or not? @eltonmesquita. For me, I like consistency.

If approved, I'll rename other files in uppercase.

pr_title: Added missing to opacity 1 for entrance animations
pr_body:
I am triggering animations via JS once the element scrolls into view. For most entrance animations, this means that I need to add `opacity:0` to the element so that we do not see the elements until I trigger the animation. 

Several of the entrance animations stopped animating opacity part way through the animation. Therefore, this would generate a flash during from where `opacity:1` was set until the end of the animation. The fix was simply to make sure that the opacity is set to 1 all the way to the end of the animation inside of the `to` block.

Add new CLI option debug-print-ast (A new --debug-print-ast CLI flag for debugging.

2.4.0

Commits
  • @forward (Additional commits viewable in

It was recently brought to my attention that Animate.css was used on a website soliciting tips for abortion bounties in Texas, where recent legislation outlawed safe access to abortion.

Abortion is a form of healthcare, and as such is a fundamental human right. By introducing this legislation, lawmakers in Texas are removing the bodily autonomy of women and endangering their well-being by forcing them to seek potentially unsafe alternatives.

Amnesty International [states](LINK
> Access to safe abortion services is a human right. Under international human rights law, everyone has a right to life, a right to health, and a right to be free from violence, discrimination, and torture or cruel, inhuman and degrading treatment.

Removal of access to abortion is one thing, but rewarding bounties for disclosure of information about women seeking abortions puts them in immense physical danger and is itself a violation of their human rights.

Not only this, but these legal changes are unconstitutional and the changes themselves violate international UN Human Rights laws. 

The [Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR)](LINK Article 21, Section 3 states:
> The will of the people shall be the basis of the authority of government

More than 60% of Americans believe people should be able to obtain abortions in the first trimester of pregnancy ([source](LINK and the current presidential administration have [themselves stated](LINK that abortion rights are “non-negotiable”.

I want to make it clear to the Animate.css community and the people who use Animate.css for their work and projects that we take a firm stance in support of women’s bodily autonomy and other forms of human rights, and do not permit the use of Animate.css on any project that impedes on these rights. To this end, I plan to update Animate.css’s license to the [Hippocratic License](LINK a variation of the currently-used MIT licence which also bans the use of licensed software in projects that violate human rights.

Bumps [cssnano](LINK from 4.1.10 to 5.0.6.
Release notes

Sourced from

v5.0.0

Major changes

  • requires Node >= 10.13
  • PostCSS 8 API, so cssnano 5 does not emit warnings when running under PostCSS 8
  • updated to SVGO 2, fixing many SVG minification bugs
  • updated css-value-parser and css-selector-parser, fixing many bugs

Upgrade notes

If you use the cssnano JavaScript API, you need to change your code:

  • Replace cssnano.process() with cssnano().process() (notice the () after cssnano)

  • pass cssnano options to cssnano() instead of process()

cssnano(cssnanoOptions).process(postcssOptions)

Bug fixes

  • fix improperly discarding @font-face declarations fix translate3d() minification fix merging of @supports rules remove vulnerable dependency and always warn with bad SVG input
Maintainer changes
